data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

As always facing forward, one takes 9 steps left, 10 steps forward, 9 steps right, and 10 steps backward after facing forward. In the first example, two steps forward, nine steps left, two steps right, and 10 steps backward. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 4 steps, turn around, and are only going one way around, you will be in a position where you will return on the right. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 6 steps to return to the starting point. Take 4 steps to return to the starting point. Take 10 steps to return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
1 step means you have taken 1 step and take 7 steps. 7 steps is the same as 7 + 1. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and turn around. Take 5 steps to get to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is the intersection of street 5 and street 3. So in this way, you are turned around because you want to turn right after turning left. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning right can be accomplished within 9 steps and turning right can be accomplished in 8 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A one-way street can be travelled back around once a person changes directions. A two-way street cannot be travelled back around once you have turned one way. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If something moves, always move it in the opposite direction of the direction you are going. If you always face forward, you always face straight forward. Take 1 step left to go the other direction. Take 4 steps if taken in the same direction as the way you were taken, and one step right to go the other direction. Take 6 steps if taken in the same direction as the way you were taken (a right turn). So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you were to take 9 steps towards the starting point you take 9 steps back. If you took 2 steps then you take 2 steps. The answer: no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
This is a trick to get back to the starting point. 1 is the step you need to take after 3 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You can only take 5 left steps which are two steps from the starting point. The first instruction is to always face forward. The correct order of a first step backward is 6 steps backward, 1 step forward, 5 steps left, and 2 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In the beginning, you always face forward. In the first scenario, you always face the right. Then in the second scenario, to get back to yourself. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Place your full weight on the front foot and back foot. When you are taken from the starting point, take 2 steps left and 3 steps right with the back foot. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you will always take 3 steps right and one step backward. If you always face forward, you will always take 6 steps left. If you always face forward, you will always take 3 steps right and one step forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you turn right, you take 10 steps to get to the starting point. If you turn around, you take four steps to get to the starting point. If you take 8 steps to return to the starting point, you’ll have to take 8 more steps to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Take 6 steps followed by 10 steps, and then turn around. 10 steps followed by 9 steps then take 3 steps. Take 6 steps followed by 3 steps and turn around. The second is correct. So, the answer is No.

Take 7 steps to turn around and turn right. Turn around again and turn right. So, the answer is No.

Turn around and take 1 step, which is turning left. Take 2 steps and turn around. Take 9 steps and turn around. Take 7 steps and take right. Turn left. So, the answer is No.

To turn right means you turn right. To turn right means to turn right. No step returns you to the starting point. So the answer is No.

There are 6 steps to the left. The starting point was taken 1 step. So, the answer is No.

Take 2 steps. This instruction does not involve turning around. Make sure you take enough steps so you can actually return safely to the starting point when you turn around. So, the answer is no.

You take 3 steps back. The starting point is where you left off. You turn around and take 3 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward, you always take 7 steps left. To return to starting points, you take 5 steps backwards. So, the answer is No.

Every person takes the same amount of steps towards and away from the starting point. Take steps backwards and take a total of 7 steps. Take 9 steps left and take a total of 6 steps. So, the answer is No.

A turning around is for taking steps to return to a starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

The first part is a step by step description of the orientation of the direction we are trying to find. The second part is a step by step description of the direction we are spelled out to move around. If you always face forward it is very easy to find the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Rewinding will get you back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

One can only take one step backward. If one always faces forward, the directions do not matter. Thus, the answer is No.

The instruction to move around a room is: Take one step. If you move the object in one step, you return the object in that step. In other words: If you move the object into one step, you return the object in that step. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You start out going away from the starting point. Just because you are going around turns you into a complete circle. So, the answer is yes.

At the beginning step, you will always face forward. Once you've completed the final instructions, you can return to the starting point with the previous information. Thus, the answer is no.

The number of steps per instruction is 7. When you come to the end of the description, you stop reversing. The number of steps per instruction is 7. If you follow these instructions consecutively, you finish the last paragraph and return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

There is no way to always return to the starting point. You can only take 9 steps forward while facing forward. So, the answer is No.

Reverse directions go from left to right and right to left. The first one is always up. You cannot return to the starting point if you are already backward. So, the answer is yes.

Revolving is how you get to your starting point. It always points towards the right. So, the answer is Yes.

Taking 2 steps backward does not return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

To return to the starting point, you would need to take 10 steps. Taking 10 steps doesn't mean you take all 10 steps. Take right turn = 100 feet. Take left turn = 60 feet. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 8 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Take 4 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward you are much more likely to always be forward. On the first step, you take 7 steps left. On the same step taking 8 steps right, you take 4 steps right. On the last step, you take 10 steps backwards, you take 4 steps left. So, the answer is yes.

We have 9 steps forward. We have 4 steps backward. We have 3 steps forth. We have 4 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

The first step is from the starting point, and the last step is in the opposite direction. If you go from right to left, it is always in the direction that you were going from. So, the answer is no.

Just because you have 10 steps doesn't mean you have to turn right after this. The 9 steps take you back to the starting point and you cannot turn that far right. If you turn right after the 3 steps you would not turn 2 step back and then turn left. Thus, the answer is no.

If you always face forward you would get the feeling that you are being directed towards left. The answer is no.

The first step to facing backward is to face forward. The second step is to take 2 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

Take 1 step forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 1 step left. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first time that you take 10 steps backward becomes 7 steps backward. Later, it becomes 10 steps forward and then 8 steps backward. If you take 10 steps backward, you will always be facing forward. If you take 8 steps backward, you will take 8 steps backward. If you take 7 steps backward, you will take 7 steps backward. If you take 1 step right, you will be 7 steps right. If you take 4 steps left, you will be 4 steps left. Final answer: No.

When starting, always face forward. When you take 7 steps backward, you take 7 steps backward. When you take 4 steps forward, you take 4 steps forward. When you take 1 step left, you take 1 step left. So, the answer is Yes.
